intro: Oritrophium hieracioides, commonly known as the threadleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant features slender, thread-like leaves and produces small, yellow to orange composite flowers. Its flowering period occurs in the summer months, and it is often found in open grasslands and sagebrush communities. Oritrophium hieracioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
